intro: Ternstroemia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ternstroemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, China, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical to lanceolate in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
